page.title: 14The Princetown Railway.
page.content: On the left hand side of our 'D' block is an old overgrown railway track.It is called the{Princetown Railway.}Some of the engines are being restored so that they can once more run along the line.For 6 pence,in old money,passengers could go to the centre of{Plymouth}up to the 196O's. The train that went into Plymouth was nick-named the 'Woolworth Special',it} would take from half to three quarters of an hour to go from{Shaugh Halt}into town by the steam engine.It worked seven days a week,Saturday & Sunday being the most popular days for people to ride on it.On average it carried about 60 people.One day some enthusiasts may bring it back(I hope so!).
